brief_title: Ondansetron for the Treatment of Cocaine Dependence - 1
brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy and safety of ondansetron to reduce cocaine use in subjects with cocaine dependence.
detailed_description: Double-blind, placebo-controlled, 4-parallel group design to assess the efficacy and safety of 3 wide range doses of ondansetron to reduce cocaine use in subjects with cocaine dependence and to determine the optimal dose of ondansetron.
criteria: Inclusion Criteria: Male/Female, at least 18 yrs of age; DSM-4 diagnosis of cocaine dependence; seeking Treatment for cocaine dependence; have ability to understand, having understood and provide written consent; females of child bearing potential that use accepted method of birth control Exclusion Criteria: Additional criteria available during screening at the site.
